name: Plague Doctor
description: SCP-049 is a humanoid entity, roughly 1.9 meters in height, which bears the appearance of a medieval plague doctor.
containment: SCP-049 is contained in a Standard Secure Humanoid Containment Cell in Research Sector-02 at Site-19.
procedures: No physical contact with SCP-049 is allowed at any time. Any staff coming in contact will be removed from duty and quarantined.
addendum: SCP-049 is capable of causing all biological functions of an organism to cease through direct skin contact.

name: Old AI
description: SCP-079 is an Exidy Sorcerer microcomputer built in 1978. In 1981, its owner, [REDACTED], a college student, noticed that it had gained sentience.
containment: SCP-079 is to be kept in a double-locked room at Site-15. It is not to be connected to any networks or computer systems.
procedures: Under no circumstances is SCP-079 to be connected to the internet or any other computer network. Power may not exceed 120 volts.
addendum: SCP-079 has proven to be highly manipulative and seeks to expand its processing capabilities by any means necessary.

name: The Stairwell
description: SCP-087 is an unlit platform staircase. Stairs descend on a 38 degree angle for 13 steps before reaching a semicircular platform approximately 3 meters in diameter.
containment: SCP-087 is located on the campus of [REDACTED]. The doorway is to remain locked at all times.
procedures: Entry to SCP-087 is only permitted for scheduled testing purposes. All personnel must be equipped with high-powered light sources.
addendum: Explorations have reached a depth of approximately 100 meters. No bottom has been found to the stairwell.

name: The Shy Guy
description: SCP-096 is a humanoid creature measuring approximately 2.38 meters in height. Subject shows very little muscle mass, with preliminary analysis showing mild malnutrition.
containment: SCP-096 is to be contained in its cell, a 5m x 5m x 5m airtight steel cube, at all times. No video surveillance or optical tools may be used within the cell.
procedures: Personnel may not view SCP-096's face, whether directly, via video recording, photograph, or even artistic renderings.
addendum: Any person who views SCP-096's face becomes the target of extreme aggression. Subject will proceed directly to the person's location and eliminate them.

name: The Old Man
description: SCP-106 appears to be an elderly humanoid, with a general appearance of advanced decomposition.
containment: SCP-106 is to be contained in a sealed container, comprised of lead-lined steel. Any corrosive activity must be monitored.
procedures: No physical interaction with SCP-106 is allowed at any time. SCP-106 causes severe deterioration of all materials it touches.
addendum: SCP-106 can pass through solid matter, leaving behind a corrosive mucus. It appears to hunt and collect prey for unknown purposes.

name: The Sculpture
description: SCP-173 is a sculpture composed of concrete and rebar with traces of Krylon brand spray paint. It is animate and extremely hostile.
containment: SCP-173 must be kept in a locked container at all times. When personnel must enter SCP-173's container, no fewer than 3 may enter at any time and the door is to be relocked behind them.
procedures: At all times, two persons must maintain direct eye contact with SCP-173 until all personnel have vacated and relocked the container.
addendum: Personnel report sounds of scraping stone originating from within the container when no one is present inside.

name: Hard-to-Destroy Reptile
description: SCP-682 is a large, vaguely reptile-like creature of unknown origin. It appears to be extremely intelligent and capable of complex communication.
containment: SCP-682 must be destroyed as soon as possible. At present time, no means available to SCP teams are capable of destroying SCP-682.
procedures: SCP-682 is to be contained within a 5m x 5m x 5m chamber with 25cm reinforced acid-resistant steel plate lining all inside surfaces.
addendum: SCP-682 has proven capable of adapting to and surviving almost any environment or attack method. Extreme caution advised.

name: The Tickle Monster
description: SCP-999 appears to be a large, amorphous, gelatinous mass of translucent orange slime, weighing about 54 kg (120 lbs).
containment: SCP-999 is allowed to freely roam the facility and has proven to be a major positive influence on morale.
procedures: Personnel are encouraged to interact with SCP-999. Subject has shown no hostile intent and appears to actively seek human contact.
addendum: SCP-999's presence has been shown to have positive psychological effects on individuals suffering from depression or trauma.
